fields.name: metric
fields.description: Get a single metric of a single device.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the metric to retrieve.

args.name: deviceId
args.description: The ID of the device to retrieve the metric from.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Get multiple metrics described by the given metric descriptors.

fields.name: dataSets
fields.description: Get multiple data sets described by the given data set descriptors.

fields.name: metricNames
fields.description: Get the names of the available metrics of a device.

args.name: deviceId
args.description: The ID of the device to retrieve the metric roles of.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: Get a list of nodes.

args.name: minDistance
args.description: Set to `0` to include this node itself.

args.name: parentIds
args.description:
A list of parent node IDs to get the children of. To get root nodes use
`null` as parent ID. When an array is passed (possibly containing
`null`) then `maxDistance` defaults to `1`.

fields.name: contracts
fields.description: Get a collection of contracts.

fields.name: customers
fields.description: Get a collection of customers.

fields.name: smokeDetectorProtocol
fields.description: Retrieve a single smoke detector protocol by ID.

fields.name: smokeDetectorProtocols
fields.description: Retrieve multiple smoke detector protocols.

fields.name: users
fields.description: Get a collection of users.

args.name: userIds
args.description: A list of user IDs.

args.name: id
args.description:
The ID of the node to get all decedents node's WiFis. If the ID refers to a
node of type `PROPERTY`, then this node's WiFi is returned.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: BindingProcess
types.description: Information about the binding process of a device.

types.name: Device
types.description: An IoT device that provides measurements about the world.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the metric to retrieve.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The javascript `Date` as string. Type represents date and time as the ISO Date string.

types.name: Node
types.description:
The `Node` model forms a forest/multi-rooted tree providing the logical
organisation structure for `Gateway`s and `Device`s.

The default order of the tree is pre-order with individual levels ordered by
the `order` and `name` fields.

fields.name: ancestor
fields.description: The farthest ancestor node of this node matching the given filter, if any.

args.name: minDistance
args.description: Set to `0` to include this node itself.

fields.name: ancestors
fields.description:
The ancestor nodes of this node that match the given filter ordered from
far to close (e.g. from root node to parent node with default filter).

args.name: minDistance
args.description: Set to `0` to include this node itself.

fields.name: descendant
fields.description: The first descendant node of this node matching the given filter.

args.name: minDistance
args.description: Set to `0` to include this node itself.

fields.name: descendants
fields.description: The descendant nodes of this node that match the given filter.

args.name: minDistance
args.description: Set to `0` to include this node itself.

fields.name: rooms
fields.description: All nodes of type `ROOM` in this node's subtree (including this node).

types.name: NodeType
types.description:
The type of a node.

- `DIRECTORY`: An arbitrary organizational node. Can be a root node or the
  child of another node of type `DIRECTORY`.
- `PROPERTY`: A building with a specific master gateway. Can be a root
  node or the child of another node of type `DIRECTORY`.
- `FLOOR`: A floor inside a building. Can be a child of another node of
  type `PROPERTY`.
- `APARTMENT`: An apartment on a floor. Can be a child of another node of
  type `FLOOR`.
- `ROOM`: A room on a floor or inside an apartment: Can be a child of
  another node of type `FLOOR` or `APARTMENT`.
- `SPOT`: A spot is a mounting point for sensors in rooms: Can be a child of
  another node of type `ROOM`.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: FloorType
types.description:
The type of a node which has a type floor:

- `ROOF`: Which are located in the `ROOF`.
- `OVERGROUND`: Which are located in the `OVERGROUND`.
- `UNDERGROUND`: Which are located in the `UNDERGROUND`.

types.name: TreeOrder
types.description:
The type of a node.

- `PRE`: [Pre-order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_traversal#Pre-order_(NLR))
- `POST`: [Post-order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_traversal#Post-order_(LRN))

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: GatewayState
types.description:
State of a gateway.

- `UNKNOWN`
- `ONLINE`
- `OFFLINE`

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Highest severity of alerts.

types.name: AlertSeverity
types.description:
Severity of an alert.

- `WARNING`: Warning
- `ALERT`: Alert

types.name: MetricAggregation
types.description: A `MetricAggregation`.

types.name: MetricKind
types.description:
The kind of a metric.

- `CONTINUOUS`: A set of continuous data points, which may be inter-
  and/or extrapolated.
- `DISCRETE`: A set of discrete data points, which represent the state of
  the measured object, e.g. on/off.

types.name: Metric
types.description:
A `Metric` represents a time series of a specific measurement of the
world.

types.name: BindingProcessState
types.description:
The state of a binding process of a device.

- `IDLE`: Ready to start process.
- `STARTED`
- `IN_PROGRESS`
- `WAITING`: Waiting for user action. For example start pairing mode on
  device.
- `DONE`
- `FAILED`

types.name: Order
types.description:
Ordering of a collection.

- `ASC`: Ascending
- `DESC`: Descending

types.name: TimeUnit
types.description:
Unit of time.

- `DAY`: Day
- `HOUR`: Hour
- `MINUTE`: Minute
- `SECOND`: Second

fields.name: version
fields.description: Record version used for optimistic locking.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
This represents an external reference of this contract, e.g. from the
Unitymedia/Vodafone CRM.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: The nodes of type `PROPERTY` covered by this contract.

types.name: User
types.description: The `User` model represents a user of the system.

types.name: Customer
types.description:
A customer represents a business or partner using services of this software
stack.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Record version used for optimistic locking.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
This represents an external reference of this customer, e.g. from the
Unitymedia/Vodafone CRM.

fields.name: directories
fields.description: The nodes of type `DIRECTORY` owned and administered by this customer.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: The nodes of type `PROPERTY` covered by this customer's contracts.

types.name: SmokeDetectorProtocol
types.description:
The `SmokeDetectorProtocol` model represents a checklist taken for one or
more smoke detector devices at a specific point in time.

types.name: SmokeDetectorProtocolNode
types.description: The `SmokeDetectorProtocolNode` model represents a user of the system.

fields.name: node
fields.description:
The `Node` which this smoke detector node was derived from, if it still
exists.

types.name: SmokeDetectorProtocolDevice
types.description:
The `SmokeDetectorProtocolDevice` contains information about a smoke
detector device.

fields.name: device
fields.description:
The `Device` which this smoke detector device was derived from, if it
still exists.

types.name: SmokeDetectorProtocolCheck
types.description:
The `SmokeDetectorProtocolCheck` model contains a snapshot of a smoke
detector device  a user of the system.

types.name: Wifi
types.description: A Wifi with configuration and gateways

types.name: WifiGateway
types.description: Gateway participating in a WiFi.

fields.name: startBindingProcess
fields.description: Bind a device.

fields.name: addDevice
fields.description: Add a device.

fields.name: removeDevice
fields.description:
Remove a device.

Returns `true`, if a device was found and removed, otherwise `false`.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the device to remove.

fields.name: switchLamp
fields.description: Switch a lamp device on or off.

fields.name: addGateway
fields.description: Add a gateway.

args.name: gateway
args.description: The data object describing the gateway to add.

fields.name: addNode
fields.description: Add a node. A whole tree of nodes can be added via the children key.

args.name: parentId
args.description:
An ID of a node that will become the parent of the added node. This
argument can be skipped or set to `null` in order to make the added
node a root node.

args.name: node
args.description: The data object describing the node to add.

fields.name: setPermissionsForUser
fields.description: Set permissions for a single user.

fields.name: addContract
fields.description: Add a contract.

fields.name: addCustomer
fields.description: Add a customer.

fields.name: editContract
fields.description: Edit a customer.

fields.name: editCustomer
fields.description: Set or unset a customer contact user.

fields.name: removeContract
fields.description: Remove a contract.

fields.name: removeCustomer
fields.description: Remove a customer.

fields.name: createSmokeDetectorProtocol
fields.description: Create a smoke detector procotol.

fields.name: deleteSmokeDetectorProtocol
fields.description: Create a smoke detector procotol.

fields.name: addUser
fields.description: Add a user.

fields.name: removeUser
fields.description: Remove a user.

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Request password reset for a User.

fields.name: setAllowedAppsForUser
fields.description: Set the apps the user is allowed to use.

fields.name: updateUser
fields.description: Update a user.

fields.name: changeWifiConfiguration
fields.description: Update Wifi SSID and/or encryption key.

inputFields.name: siteId
inputFields.description:
The node the added device will be associated with. Only nodes of type
`ROOM` are allowed as association targets.

inputFields.name: deviceId
inputFields.description: The ID of the lamp device which should be switched.

types.name: LampState
types.description:
Switch state of a lamp.

- `ON`: On
- `OFF`: Off

types.name: AddUserInput
types.description: The data object describing the user to add.

types.name: UserRole
types.description:
Role for this user, string value matches the name of the rule in keycloak.

- `ADMIN`: Admin
- `EXPERT`: Expert
- `USER`: User

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the user that should be removed.

types.name: ResetPasswordInput
types.description: The data object containing the email for which to send a password reset request to keycloak.

types.name: UpdateUserInput
types.description: The data object containing new values for the user, referenced by id.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the node of type `PROPERTY` of which the WiFi should be updated.

fields.name: metricChanges
fields.description: Subscribe to multiple metrics described by the given metric descriptors.

types.name: MetricChange
types.description: A `Metric` change.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: key
args.description: Specify the store key.

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
